intro: Fagara peckoltiana, commonly known as the Peckolt's soursop, is a member of the Rutaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that can grow up to 10 meters in height, featuring glossy, dark green leaves with a slightly serrated margin. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by spherical, green fruits that turn yellow when ripe. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
